titleStmt.title: A tigi (?) to Ninurta for I&c;me-Dagan (I&c;me-Dagan O) -- an English prose translation

publicationStmt.distributor: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature

address.addrLine: The Oriental Institute, University of Oxford, Pusey Lane, Oxford OX1 2LE, UK, email etcsl@orinst.ox.ac.uk, http://etcsl.orinst.ox.ac.uk

seriesStmt.p: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature aims to make accessible over 400 literary works composed in the Sumerian language in ancient Mesopotamia during the late third and early second millennia BC. The works are in Sumerian composite transliteration and English prose translation with bibliographical information on each composition.

sourceDesc.p: Sources are listed in the header of the composite text

lg.p:
Great hero, strongest in heaven and earth! Ninurta, who controls perfectly the fifty divine powers in the E-kur! &X;&X; governor for his father, rising raging storm, who extends terror &X;&X; towards the foreign countries. &X;&X; roaring &X;&X;, who casts fear upon the people, who has no rival! Ninurta, surpassing in vigour! &X;&X; great and majestic strength &X;&X;, &X;&X; of Enlil, &X;&X; of Enlil, ornament of the august shrine! &X;&X; whose radiance &X;&X;!
&X;&X; the neck-stock of the gods.
&X;&X; among the Anuna gods. &X;&X; exceptionally mighty &X;&X;. &X;&X; lord, the son of Enlil, who has come forth from the hills, and rides (?) upon the numerous divine powers. &X;&X; great hero, surpassing dragon, perfect lord, &X;&X; without rival (?)! Great hero confident in his strength!
&X;&X;, whose decisions cannot be countermanded, &X;&X; what he says is firm. &X;&X; august son of Enlil! &X;&X; overpowers (?) the mountains, &X;&X; the Great Mountain Enlil &X;&X; in the E-kur, throughout the entire extent of heaven and earth. &X;&X; his great &X;&X; covers &X;&X;. &X;&X; raging &X;&X;.
His words are precious, and what he says is true. Ninurta, lion raging against the disobedient! Authoritative one, who makes the foreign countries submit &X;&X;.
May Ninurta look upon I&c;me-Dagan &X;&X; with a life-giving gaze!

Uta-ulu, riding on fearsome radiance &X;&X;, greatest amongst the great lords &X;&X;! Ninurta, perfect in authority, caretaker of heaven and earth &X;&X;, lord who was given strength by Nunamnir, confident in his strength &X;&X;! Ninurta, foremost &X;&X;! Enlil &X;&X;! &X;&X; like a butting bull! &X;&X; your foot on the disobedient! Great hero &X;&X;! &X;&X; the distant hills! &X;&X; the enemy lands into the king's hands! Ninurta, &X;&X; helper of I&c;me-Dagan in the mêlée! &X;&X; his majestic weapon! &X;&X; the rebellious, disobedient land! &X;&X; his majestic mace the enemy! &X;&X; battle &X;&X; enemy! May &X;&X; I&c;me-Dagan &X;&X;!

lg.note: Segments C and D might well belong to a separate composition
lg.p: &X;&X; lord of the nether world. Enki &X;&X;.

lg.note: Segments C and D might well belong to a separate composition

&X;&X; the neck-stock of the gods. &X;&X; who has no rival, &X;&X; the foreign countries. Ninurta, &X;&X; Anuna gods! Lord in the E-kur, mighty &X;&X;! Uta-ulu &X;&X; great strength &X;&X;, who has come forth from the hills and &X;&X; on the numerous divine powers! Ninurta &X;&X;, perfect lord &X;&X;! Great hero, who &X;&X; the mountains, and destroys their stones (?) totally!

Adviser, whose decisions cannot be countermanded! Ninurta, whose utterances are firm! Hero, lord, august son of Enlil! &X;&X; overpowers (?) the mountains. Ninurta, prominent in the E-kur! His huge storm &X;&X;. &X;&X; furious &X;&X; against the rebel lands.
Ninurta, &X;&X;, great hero, who &X;&X; the enemy. Hero &X;&X; Enlil &X;&X;.
&X;&X; wicked &X;&X;. His &X;&X; on the foreign countries, &X;&X; covers the Land like a garment.
Great hero, &X;&X;. The Anuna gods &X;&X;. His &X;&X;, &X;&X; are precious. &X;&X;, lion raging against &X;&X;. &X;&X;, who makes &X;&X; submit &X;&X;.

Uta-ulu &X;&X; in majesty. &X;&X; the battle-mace &X;&X; the enemy. Ninurta, surpassing in authority, caretaker for &X;&X;! Lord who was given great strength by Nunamnir, confident in his strength, striding into battle! Ninurta, &X;&X; foremost &X;&X;, great wild bull, &X;&X; by Enlil &X;&X;!
&X;&X; of Enlil, the Great Mountain. &X;&X; the distant hills. &X;&X; the enemy &X;&X;. into his hands. &X;&X; I&c;me-Dagan, the son of &X;&X;.
